question: What does it mean when music is written in a certain key?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?
answer_sentence: Construction costs would tend to be slightly higher because of the longer (higher) columns required, which in turn need to be stronger because of (typically) larger roof systems such as bar joists or trusses.

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why are the ceilings in so many grocery stores so high?

question: Why is the US Constitution regarded so highly?

question: Why is the US Constitution regarded so highly?

question: - does the human body really have a 24 hour body clock?
answer_sentence: Kinda, yes.

question: - does the human body really have a 24 hour body clock?
answer_sentence: We have a [circadian clock](_URL_0_), a biological mechanism that works by releasing certain hormones over a 24 hour period, as well as taking external cues such as the Sun.

question: - does the human body really have a 24 hour body clock?
answer_sentence: Without external cues, the circadian clock can actually run a bit longer or shorter than 24 hours, and in babies it's still all messed up (which is why they have an irregular sleep schedule).

question: - does the human body really have a 24 hour body clock?
answer_sentence: Not just humans have a circadian clock, almost every animal does.

question: - does the human body really have a 24 hour body clock?
answer_sentence: This has nothing to do with leap years though, since leap years just add a whole day, not messing with our circadian clock.

question: How does the silencer on a gun work?
answer_sentence: A gun is loud for two reasons.

question: How does the silencer on a gun work?

question: How does the silencer on a gun work?

question: How does the silencer on a gun work?

question: How does the silencer on a gun work?

question: When you're swimming, why doesn't the water flood your ears and kill you?
answer_sentence: Lucky for you, your ear has a protective barrier called your tympanic membrane (eardrum).

question: When you're swimming, why doesn't the water flood your ears and kill you?
answer_sentence: This keeps the middle and inner ear separated from the outside environment.

question: When you're swimming, why doesn't the water flood your ears and kill you?
answer_sentence: Even if your eardrum gets torn, your body has a connection from the ear to the throat known as your Eustachian tube so if you were to go swimming with a perforated eardrum (a bad idea since the risk for infection skyrockets), you'd still be alright.
